TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit HtmlFormParameterWriter extends System.Web.Services.Protocols.UrlEncodedParameterWriter

Docs.summary: Writes outgoing request parameters for Web services implemented using HTTP with name-value pairs encoded like an HTML form rather than as a SOAP message.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HtmlFormParameterWriter> and other classes in the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols> namespace support the .NET Framework's implementations of Web services via the HTTP-GET and HTTP-POST operations. Web service writers and readers serialize and deserialize, respectively, between the parameters or return objects of Web methods and the HTTP request or response streams. Web service writers and readers use HTTP for transport but don't exchange messages using the SOAP standard.The client-side <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HtmlFormParameterWriter> class provides methods to write parameter name-value pairs to the body of an HTTP request with the MIME type `application/x-www-form-urlencoded`.
You typically will not need to use <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HtmlFormParameterWriter> directly. When the Wsdl.exe tool generates client proxy code according to the HTTP-POST implementation, it applies the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HttpMethodAttribute> to each Web method and sets the attribute's <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HttpMethodAttribute.ParameterFormatter%2A> property to <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HtmlFormParameterWriter>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void InitializeRequest (System.Net.WebRequest request, object[] values);

remarks.format: ## Remarks The outgoing request allows HTTP and other transport protocols.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether Web method parameter values are serialized to the outgoing HTTP request body.
Docs.value: to indicate that the Web method parameters are serialized. This property always returns .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HtmlFormParameterWriter.UsesWriteRequest%2A> property determines whether the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HtmlFormParameterWriter.WriteRequest%2A> method is invoked.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void WriteRequest (System.IO.Stream requestStream, object[] values);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void WriteRequest(class System.IO.Stream requestStream, object[] values) cil managed

Docs.param: An input stream for the outgoing HTTP request's body.
Docs.summary: Serializes Web method parameter values into a stream representing the outgoing HTTP request body.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.HtmlFormParameterWriter.WriteRequest%2A>method calls the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.UrlEncodedParameterWriter.Encode%2A> writer,object[] values)?qualifyHint=True&autoUpgrade=True method.
